newsitem.title: USA: Tenneco gas line rupture cuts 10 mmcfd.
newsitem.headline: Tenneco gas line rupture cuts 10 mmcfd.

text.p: Tenneco Inc unit Tennessee Gas Pipe Line said a rupture on a natural gas feeder line in the Mississippi River shut in about 10 million cubic feet per day of supply.
"There was a rupture and fire at about 0530 CDT this morning. We isolated the line at about 0730 and the fire was out shortly after," a company spokesman said.
He said the 12-inch feeder line that flows into the company's 500 line was located about 60 miles southeast of New Orleans, La, in an area known as Tiger Pass.
The spokesman said gas from one platform was shut in, adding "There's been no significant impact on customer service."
The U.S. Goast Guard said the line ruptured after it was struck by a dredge.
